title: An Introduction to Residuality Theory
image_de: Barry O'Reilly während seines Vortrags zur Residuality Theory. Im Hintergrund eine Präsentationsfolie mit Grafiken zur Komplexität.
image_en: Barry O'Reilly during his talk on Residuality Theory.
speaker: Barry O'Reilly

timeline.description_de: Warum ist Software Architektur so schwer zu lehren?
timeline.description_en: Why is software architecture so difficult to teach?

quotes.text: Time, change, and uncertainty are the three fundamental forces that will come along and destroy your architecture.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: We’re putting an ordered system into a disordered system, and the first thing that happens is the disordered system tears our architecture apart.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: The most powerful architects cannot predict the future. They say, they are just magic.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: The residue is what’s left of your system after stress, and it becomes the building block for future design.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: The edge of chaos is the balance that allows your system to survive in an environment you neither control nor fully understand.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: We’re not in control of reality, but we can design architectures that survive reality.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly

quotes.text: If you're trying to seek correctness in a complex system, you're going to be sad all the time.
quotes.author: Barry O'Reilly
